code: @Manual{,   title = {when: Definition of Date and Time Dimension Tables},   author = {Jose Samos},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/josesamos/when},   url = {https://josesamos.github.io/when/}, }

what: Definition of Date and Time Dimension Tables
title: Definition of Date and Time Dimension Tables
text: dimension plays fundamental role Multidimensional Systems, allows us express analysed focus attention occurred. purpose package assist implementation dimension multidimensional systems. particular, supports generation tables implementation date time ROLAP (Relational -Line Analytical Processing) systems.

title: Definition of Date and Time Dimension Tables
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("josesamos/when")

title: Definition of Date and Time Dimension Tables
text: obtain table dates indicate start end date. Alternatively can indicate set dates consider. can select level detail, attributes include language literals day month names. following example indicate language different one computer’s operating system. result obtained shown . want table time, indicate type using parameter. default get seconds day can also configure different period level detail. start end result table shown . day_part predefined English. Literals associated hours can changed using configuration function. addition obtaining tibble, can export tables files csv xlsx format. can also exported directly Relational DBMS.
code: library(when)  date <-   when(     locale = Sys.setlocale("LC_TIME", "English"),     start = lubridate::today(),     end = lubridate::today() + 9   ) |>   generate_table() |>   get_table() pander::pandoc.table(date, split.table = Inf) time <-   when(type = 'time') |>   generate_table() |>   get_table() pander::pandoc.table(rbind(head(time, 5), tail(time, 5)),                      split.table = Inf)

title: Complete date values — complete_dates
code: complete_dates(values)

title: Complete time values — complete_times
code: complete_times(values)

title: Configure dimension — configure_dimension
text: function can define characteristics dimension depend levels includes, name, type, location day week begins.

title: Configure dimension — configure_dimension
code: configure_dimension(td, name, type, locale, week_starts_monday)  # S3 method for when configure_dimension(   td,   name = "when",   type = NULL,   locale = Sys.getlocale("LC_TIME"),   week_starts_monday = TRUE )

title: Configure dimension — configure_dimension
text: td object. name string, table name. type string, type calendar (NULL, 'iso', 'epi' 'time'). locale locale, use day month names. week_starts_monday boolean.

title: Configure dimension — configure_dimension
text: week_starts_monday parameter affects numbering days, weeks. week number associated date depends type date dimension selected: standard (NULL), ISO 8601 ('iso') epidemiological ('epi'). standard week numbers blocks 7 days beginning January 1. last week year can less 7 days long. ISO 8601 week numbers blocks 7 days Monday Sunday. first last week year can contain days previous next year. epidemiological week like ISO 8601 considers week begins Sunday, numbers blocks Sunday Monday.

title: Configure dimension — configure_dimension
code: td <- when() |>   configure_dimension(name = 'when', type = 'time')

title: Define instances — define_instances
text: Using function can define instances dimension generated according rest defined characteristics.

title: Define instances — define_instances
code: define_instances(td, start, end, values)  # S3 method for when define_instances(td, start = NULL, end = NULL, values = NULL)

title: Define instances — define_instances
text: td object. start string, start period included dimension. end string, end period included dimension. values vector string.

title: Define instances — define_instances
text: must indicate dates date components ISO 8601 format (yyyy-mm-dd). times hh:mm:ss format.

title: Define instances — define_instances
code: td_1 <- when() |>   define_instances(start = "2020", end = "2030")  td_1 <- when() |>   define_instances(start = "2020-01-01", end = "2030-01-01")  td_2 <- when(type = 'time') |>   define_instances(values = 1:5)

code: generate_table(td)  # S3 method for when generate_table(td)

title: Generate table — generate_table
code: td <- when() |>   generate_table()

title: Store the table in a csv files — get_table_csv
code: get_table_csv(td, file, type)  # S3 method for when get_table_csv(td, file = NULL, type = 1)

title: Store the table in a csv files — get_table_csv
text: td object. file string, name file. type integer, 1: uses "." decimal point comma separator; 2: uses comma decimal point semicolon separator.

title: Store the table in a csv files — get_table_csv
Store the table in a csv files — get_table_csv
code: file <- when() |>   generate_table() |>   get_table_csv()

what: Store the table in a relational database — get_table_rdb
title: Store the table in a relational database — get_table_rdb
text: configuration elements defined dimension table generated, using function can obtain table format Relational DBMS.

title: Store the table in a relational database — get_table_rdb
code: get_table_rdb(td, con, overwrite)  # S3 method for when get_table_rdb(td, con, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Store the table in a relational database — get_table_rdb
text: td object. con DBI::DBIConnection object. overwrite boolean, allow overwriting tables database.

title: Store the table in a relational database — get_table_rdb
Store the table in a relational database — get_table_rdb
code: my_db <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite())  when() |>   generate_table() |>   get_table_rdb(my_db) #> Error: .onLoad failed in loadNamespace() for 'dm', details: #>   call: (function (packages, top_level_fun, use = TRUE)  #>   error: The packages "DiagrammeR" and "DiagrammeRsvg" are required to use #> `register_pkgdown_methods()`.  DBI::dbDisconnect(my_db)

Include date levels — include_date_levels
text: dimension defined date type, using function can select levels include : day, week, month year.

title: Include date levels — include_date_levels
code: include_date_levels(td, day_level, week_level, month_level, year_level)  # S3 method for when include_date_levels(   td,   day_level = TRUE,   week_level = TRUE,   month_level = TRUE,   year_level = TRUE )

title: Include date levels — include_date_levels
text: td object. day_level boolean, include day level. week_level boolean, include week level. month_level boolean, include month level. year_level boolean, include year level.

title: Include date levels — include_date_levels
code: td <- when() |>   include_date_levels(week_level = FALSE)

title: Include day level — include_day_level
text: dimension defined date type, using function can select day level attributes include : date, month_day, week_day, quarter_day year_day.

title: Include day level — include_day_level
code: include_day_level(   td,   day_level,   include_date,   include_month_day,   include_week_day,   include_day_name,   include_day_abbr,   include_day_num_name,   include_day_num_abbr,   include_quarter_day,   include_year_day )  # S3 method for when include_day_level(   td,   day_level = TRUE,   include_date = TRUE,   include_month_day = TRUE,   include_week_day = TRUE,   include_day_name = TRUE,   include_day_abbr = TRUE,   include_day_num_name = TRUE,   include_day_num_abbr = TRUE,   include_quarter_day = TRUE,   include_year_day = TRUE )

title: Include day level — include_day_level
text: td object. day_level boolean, include day level. include_date boolean, include date. include_month_day boolean, include day number month. include_week_day boolean, day number week. include_day_name boolean, include name day week. include_day_abbr boolean, include name day week abbreviated version. include_day_num_name boolean, include number name day week. include_day_num_abbr boolean, include number name day week abbreviated version. include_quarter_day boolean, include number day quarter. include_year_day boolean, include number day year.

title: Include day level — include_day_level
text: week_day day number, name name abbreviation. order names corresponds alphabetical order, combination day number name /abbreviation included.

title: Include day level — include_day_level
code: td <- when() |>   include_day_level(include_day_abbr = FALSE,                     include_day_num_abbr = FALSE)

title: Include month level — include_month_level
text: dimension defined date type, using function can select month level attributes include : month, quarter semester.

title: Include month level — include_month_level
code: include_month_level(   td,   month_level,   include_month,   include_year_month,   include_month_name,   include_month_abbr,   include_month_num_name,   include_month_num_abbr,   include_quarter,   include_year_quarter,   include_semester,   include_year_semester )  # S3 method for when include_month_level(   td,   month_level = TRUE,   include_month = TRUE,   include_year_month = TRUE,   include_month_name = TRUE,   include_month_abbr = TRUE,   include_month_num_name = TRUE,   include_month_num_abbr = TRUE,   include_quarter = TRUE,   include_year_quarter = TRUE,   include_semester = TRUE,   include_year_semester = TRUE )

title: Include month level — include_month_level
text: td object. month_level boolean, include month level. include_month boolean, include month number. include_year_month boolean, include year-month combination. include_month_name boolean, include month name. include_month_abbr boolean, include month name abbreviated version. include_month_num_name boolean, include month number name. include_month_num_abbr boolean, include month number name abbreviated version. include_quarter boolean, include quarter field. include_year_quarter boolean, include quarter field. include_semester boolean, include semester field. include_year_semester boolean, include semester field.

title: Include month level — include_month_level
text: can also obtain combination year mentioned attributes. month month number year, name abbreviation name. order names corresponds alphabetical order, combination month number name /abbreviation included.

title: Include month level — include_month_level
code: td <- when() |>   include_month_level(include_month_abbr = FALSE,                       include_month_num_abbr = FALSE)

title: Include time level — include_time_level

code: include_time_level(   td,   include_time,   include_minute,   include_second,   include_day_part )  # S3 method for when include_time_level(   td,   include_time = TRUE,   include_minute = TRUE,   include_second = TRUE,   include_day_part = TRUE )

title: Include time level — include_time_level
text: td object. include_time boolean, include field time. include_minute boolean, include minute level detail. include_second boolean, include second level detail. include_day_part boolean, include parts day.

title: Include time level — include_time_level
text: 'hour' attribute always included. 'minute' attribute included 'second' attribute included either.

title: Include time level — include_time_level
code: td <- when() |>   include_time_level(include_day_part = FALSE)

title: Include week level — include_week_level
text: td object. week_level boolean, include week level. include_week boolean, include week number. include_year_week boolean, include year-week combination. include_week_date boolean, include date week obtained.

title: Include week level — include_week_level
text: first last days year, year associated week may different year date, depending date type selected. week number associated date depends type date dimension selected: standard (NULL), ISO 8601 ('iso') epidemiological ('epi'). standard week numbers blocks 7 days beginning January 1. last week year can less 7 days long. ISO 8601 week numbers blocks 7 days Monday Sunday. first last week year can contain days previous next year. epidemiological week like ISO 8601 considers week begins Sunday, numbers blocks Sunday Monday.

title: Include week level — include_week_level
code: td <- when() |>   include_week_level(include_week_date = FALSE)

title: when S3 class — when
code: when(   name = "when",   type = NULL,   locale = Sys.getlocale("LC_TIME"),   start = lubridate::today(),   end = lubridate::today(),   values = NULL,   ... )

title: when S3 class — when
text: name string, table name. type string, type calendar (NULL, 'iso', 'epi' 'time'). locale locale, use day month names. start string, start period included dimension. end string, end period included dimension. values vector string. ... Rest boolean configuration parameters.

title: when S3 class — when
text: Using parameters function can configure practically  elements dimension. Alternatively, can use configuration functions define available options. discuss parameters specific configuration functions.

title: when S3 class — when
code: td_1 <- when()  td_2 <- when(type = 'time')
